div.p: Greetings. My quartan fever has become milder, and the colic pains have also been alleviated with the application of medicines (praise be to God), so that I am able to write to you with my own hand, most reverend man and most deserving patron of the Church of Christ and the Christian commonwealth. Therefore, I will now write to you about our matters a little more extensively. Our Felix Lavater, a pious and studious young man, as I understand, wishes to move from his lodging and live with me; whether he is serious about this or not, I do not know. However, I have indicated to him that, due to the old relationship of my parent, which existed with you and others, I would do something, even though I have not wished to have boarders and have asked for a thaler each week for board and lodging, which indeed was the price I had before tri-...
